weather_report:
As the evening settles gently over Downtown San Francisco, a soft blanket of patchy fog begins to weave its way through the streets, whispering secrets of the Pacific. The air hangs cool and inviting, with a low of around 49 degrees, while a gentle breeze brushes against the skin, courtesy of a west-northwest wind. The clouds, like fleeting thoughts, turn the night sky into a muted canvas, obscuring but not entirely hiding the twinkling lights of the city. 

Looking ahead to Monday, the day promises a lingering morning haziness, giving way to bright, cheerful sunshine by midday. Expect a high near 58, with temperatures gradually descending as the afternoon wears on. A light north-northwest wind will accompany the day, making for a pleasant atmosphere, ideal for a leisurely stroll or perhaps a visit to one of the city's iconic coffee spots. As you venture out, layers will be your best friend—a light jacket with a cozy scarf, perhaps, to combat the crisp air, as well as comfort any thoughts of the fleeting fog. Whether you meander through Golden Gate Park or lose track of time in a small bookstore, the city invites you to savor the tranquility of January's mixed embrace of fog and clarity.
